lexUnit.name: stash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: store safely in a secret place.

sentence.text: Islamic Jihad had stashed Waite in the basement car park of a four-storey building in Baalbeck , in the Bekaa Valley .
I 'd appreciate it very much if you 'd stash the gear in the box and get the boat started up . "
He would pull over later and stash the manual in the compartment beneath the battery .
If she tells you to stash silver under Jenny Crawley 's bed , you do it , no questions .
He reached up , plucked his balls from Legion 's body and stashed them inside his capacious pockets .
You have to stash it somewhere out of sight .
Somewhere around there she can stash Jamie 's things .
He stashed the Nikon back inside his coat and rose to his feet , brushing damp mud from his jeans as he did so .
Stash old plastic or paper shopping bags near the rubbish or garbage bin and then you can re-cycle them as bin liners .
This enables them to stash five-figure sums of undisclosed gate receipts into a ` slush fund " .
Think again , Ashley told herself as , having checked that the purchases stashed in the buggy 's basket were secure , she started the return climb up the lane .
But as he made his getaway , shoppers wrestled him to the ground forcing him to drop the stolen loot — along with £200 he had stashed in a pocket — and he fled empty-handed .
As I passed the ladies I noticed that the beer crates stashed in front of the Fire Exit had been moved aside .
What the hell , people in Africa were gasping for a beer , and he had a whole case stashed here .
Susie Terhune scrabbled under her seat for the handgun stashed there .
